newsitem.title: CHINA: Large tremor rocks quake-hit northwest China area.
newsitem.headline: Large tremor rocks quake-hit northwest China area.

text.p: An earthquake measuring 6.0 on the Richter Scale hit Jiashi county in northwestern China's Xinjiang region on Saturday , in an area where about 50 people died in a tremor last month, the Xinhua news agency said.
Officials were investigating whether there were any casualties or damage from the earthquake, which struck at 2.04 p.m. (0604 GMT), Xinhua said.
The tremor was an aftershock from an earthquake of 6.4 magnitude that caused widespread damage and killed up to 50 people in Jiashi on January 21, Xinhua said.
A work team has been sent to the region, XInhua said.
"We have no reports of deaths or injuries yet," an official of the State Seismological Bureau said by telephone.
